definition: thinking and pondering (idiom); to turn sth over in one's mind/to consider repeatedly
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute
empress/queen/(archaic) monarch/ruler
back/behind/rear/afterwards/after/later/post-
surname Hou
female chicken crows at daybreak (idiom); a woman usurps authority/women meddle in politics/The female wears the trousers.
to trip forwards or stumble back (idiom, from Book of Songs); can't get anything right
has eyes but can't see (idiom); unable or unwilling to see the importance of sth/blind (to sth great)
person narrow-minded and shortsighted
lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
clay ox, wooden horse (idiom); shape without substance/worthless object
to ride to take up an official appointment (idiom); to take on a job with alacrity/to undertake a task
lit. to wear one's coat inside out and carry firewood on one's back (idiom)/fig. to live a life of poverty and hard work/fig. to act stupidly
to jump into a well to rescue sb else (idiom); fig. to help others at the risk to oneself
war on all sides (idiom); fighting from all four quarters

(of literature, music) deeply moving (idiom)

to call sth a cow or a horse (idiom); it doesn't matter what you call it/Insult me if you want, I don't care what you call me.
Sima Xiangru is meticulous and Mei Gao is fast (idiom)/to each his good points
cow and famous steed at the same trough (idiom); fig. the common and the great are treated alike
